Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very good service!”
Reviews.Author: Milla007
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend had a 2 nights stay at this hotel. The hotel is very nice, modern and situated at a very good location. We had a classic room and it was delicately decorated. From our balcony we could view the Eiffel Tower. One evening we had dinner at the hotel and the food was so good! We tried a meat and a fish course. The hotel breakfast is ok with a selection of croissants and jam + coffee/tea and juice, but you can of course order things on the side. The staff at this hotel is VERY nice, service minded and professional! We felt so welcome and special and they took care of everything. They even managed to book a table for us at the Le Jules Verne restaurant. Normally you have too book weeks in advance to get a table there. We can highly recommend this hotel and we hope to stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ABjurling
Reviews.Content: Thia hotel has provided the best stay in Paris for me and my wife, ever. Everything with this hotel is likeable, very friendly and helpful staff, the rooms are just as big as you need and the standards of the amenities, bed and bahroom are very good. The fact that you can view the Eiffel tower from your room is a nice bonus. A lot of similar hotels are located in this area, but no one can beat the price and service level of The Metropolitan, if you plan to visit Paris this spring, do yourself a favour and stay a his hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EmilyAshUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 24th February for the weekend as a late Valentines getaway. It was very quiet probably as Paris Fashion Week was the following week and it had just been Valentines. The location is ideal and you can see the Eiffel Tower from just outside. The atmosphere is modern and perfect for what we wanted. Room was a little small even though it was a Deluxe and there was only ONE mirror in the bathroom which was half length so could have done with one in the bedroom. The staff were pretty friendly (wish I could say the same about all the French) and the pool and sauna were deserted when we used them.

Reviews.Title: “February 2012 - My first trip to paris”
Reviews.Author: Rachel P
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris. My boyfriend took me for Valentine’s Day and I was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel was in an amazing location with gorgeous views of the Eiffel Tower. We arrived later in the evening so by that time it was dark but the Eiffel Tower lit up like a candle on a cake visable from the hotel. When we checked into the hotel the staff were very welcoming and friendly. Spoke very good English and were very happy to help us out with anything that we needed. They did take 100 euro deposit from us so be aware of this if you stay here as we were not aware of this but we did get it back when we checked out. As we had arrived late we were hoping to eat in the hotel’s restaurant but we were informed by the reception staff that it does not open on a Monday so we went out to find some food (maccy ds just down the road!) Once in the room (classic room) we found it was very modern and stylish however very small and there were a few little things that could have been fixed before having someone stay in the room. Part of the wooden floor near the bed had become raised so we kept tripping over it on the way to the bathroom. Also the ceiling in the bathroom, part of it has started to come away but nothing that was dangerous or put us off our stay. Just something we think would have been nice to be fixed as it would put some people off staying there. The bathroom was lovely, had a very large shower and filled with courtesy Radisson products which smell gorgeous! We loved the fact they also provided dressing gowns and slippers (in the wardrobe) very comfy!The mini bar was stocked with drinks/snacks however very pricey! Unfortunately like most things in Paris! There was an iPod/iPhone doc and coffee machine in the room which was a very nice touch. Huge flat screen tv on the wall however the only channel in english was bbc news but no issue to us. We stayed for 2 nights and had breakfast both mornings (included in the price). They give you a selection of mini pastries, fruit juice and tea/coffee. Very small portions but if you do fancy something hot then you can order something from the menu which will cost an extra approx. 8-10 euros each (again small portions). We also visited the pool/steam room in the hotel which we thought was to die for! Very classy and up to date. Towels and changing rooms provided. A great way to relax after a long day walking round all the sights before going out to dinner. Overall because of the hotels fantastic location and very nice staff we would definitely recommend this hotel if you are going to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location - amazing”
Reviews.Author: shepherdieu
Reviews.Content: I can't fault the location of the Metropolitan ... it's in the 16th in Paris and it's a really magical part of the city. My room had a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower from the balcony as well ... which I never tired of (even if I had to go outside in -10 degree weather to see it at night). Plus it's within walking distance to Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe, plus galleries and shops. Location wise I thought it was pretty amazing. Facilities wise it does what it can with the space it has. The building is very narrow and the hotel has very limited rooms. I was in 217 which is tight, but the bathroom is pretty good space wise. Each room has a Nespresso machine and the rooms with balconies and views are a nice touch. Restaurant downstairs does a decent breakfast, the pool (which is in the basement) isn't really that relaxing and unfortunately there is no gym. Enjoyed the experience, would probably stay in the 16th again but would look for alternative accommodation given the money I spent.. Radisson is good but not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Top view from our room”
Reviews.Author: DonPedroSkien
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay here in a clean and efficent hotel as exepected from a Radisson hotel in Paris. We were upgraded to a nice room on the fourth floor above the entrance with an excellent view of the Tower. Nice breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. Fast WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivienne y
Reviews.Content: Great staff and Great food plus hotel worthy of the Raddison name ........read reviews and got a bit worried , dont listen to the negatives this is a fantastic hotel , so glad we ignored them and stayed there . Will definately choose this hotel again !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth spending all that money,very small rooms,bad service and food.”
Reviews.Author: Deepti-tourisim
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris in April,we booked Radisson because of the brand value,but we were highly disappointed with the hotel. Firstly in our booking it was mentined breakfast included, but in the moring they gave us four pieces of bread and a glass of juice.They told us that if we want something extra we have to pay.We were quite dissappointed with this kind of treatment. The room was very small,hardly any space. The only good thing was the location of the hotel,it was quite close to the Effiel tower.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KingGents
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Radisson. 2 for pleasure and 2 for business and would definitely go back. The staff is GREAT! The room we had was small but who goes to Paris to stay in their room! It is newly renovated with a very nice bathroom. Breakfast was very good. Be sure to ask for a menu if you are not given one. All my requests were fulfilled from restaurant recommendations to taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay in good location”
Reviews.Author: Andy100668
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Trocadero, about 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. We stayed in 3 different rooms during our stay - the cheaper rooms are a little cramped but the suites have reasonable space. We found the concierge desk helpful. Everything was very clean and nicely furnished. Hotel rates were comparable with others in Paris. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and stylish first class hotel with some few maintenance flaws”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: To start I will express my great satisfaction about this place. It is stylish and elegant, without beeing snobby or to much of everything. It is a small hotel, but you have everything there at the same time it is intimate and personal. The restaurant is very nice, and we went there during an evening where it was full - not by hotel guest, it was by locals. Menu and food was awesome and innovative, but the big success is their staff with their service. They couldn't do more for us and our, sometimes, difficult needs and desires. The bar is a hidden gem, and promise me that you will not miss it on the first floor! Great atmosphere, beauticful drinks, friendly and classy service, and if you are lucky you can have the corner table where you can see the Eiffel Tower! The pool area had much more to offer, and when you have a deeply look it was in need of a larger renovation. It wasn't a nice area at all, in the way it looks now, but I'm sure if they work a little bit harder, it can be nice. There are some flaws around, that are not charming, and I think pretty easely can be fixed to come up to an acceptable standard. The room was a little bit worn out and the maintenance team need to have more attention, but I have to say that the decor, fabrics, design and furnitures was in all way very excellent. The room was very tiny (as the most rooms in Paris) but dos'nt had the bad, to tiny feeling. It was in all way very lovely and suprisingly it was good space for our shopping bags and a large travel luggage. Nice standard Radisson amenities, but also bathrobes and slippers as well as a Nespresso machine in standard rooms which is much appreciated. Location is perfect. Silent, but in direct access to the Eiffel Tower with a few minutes and both the Trocadero Metro Station (with direct link to Gallerie Lafayette and Printemps) and if you add a few more minutes, you can walk to Victor Hugo Metro Station with line to Montmatre. At both places you have brasseries and cafés where you can have breakfast, specially at the Trocadero site where the view to Eiffel Tower is lovely. The are felt very safe. Taxi to CDG came promptly and costed around the 40 Euros. I would definitely stay here again during my next visit to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Boutique Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CurryA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights recently for business and had a great experience. The rooms have a well-designed modern interior aesthetic and there is free WiFi and a Nespresso Machines which are great. The rooms are small, but I have yet to stay in a hotel in Paris that has spacious rooms. I agree with the other reviews that there could be more hooks for the towels, and the bathroom sink is more form over function, but the room was very quiet and I thought the service was very attentive. One thing to note, the restaurant shuts down at night, but the hotel is about a 10 min walk from the Place Victor Hugo so there are plenty of restaurants - anyway, who goes to Paris to just eat in the Hotel? There are beautiful views of the Eiffel Tower from the front of the hotel. I'd say the service and amenities are characteristic more of a boutique hotel than a large one, but for my purposes, it worked very well. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel located very close to Trocadero and with a lovely view of the Tour Eiffel. The room was small but clean, modern, quiet, and very comfortable. As others have noted there is no long mirror, the lights in the bathroom are a bit dark, and a couple of hooks would have made a huge difference. Front desk staff was very helpful and dinner in the hotel restaurant was superb - both food and service! Better than Bon. Front desk staff were very helpful in printing off a short document.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: jeachi
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, most especially it's location (16th arr) and the clean, comfortable room (nespresso machine, comfortable bed with clean sheets). I would recommend this hotel for travelers who are a little familiar with Paris as it is outside the more touristy areas but it is easily accessible via the metro

Reviews.Title: “Superb Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: theodore W
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel with exceptional sevice. The people at the front desk were outstanding. Helpful with excellent suggestions and superb service. Arranged excellent tours of the city and did a tremendous job to serve our needs. The executive business suite was ideal for both work and comfort. The staff were extremely friendly and kind. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Brilliant Staff!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTolhurst
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried in staying in Paris as a few years ago I had a very bad experience with staff at a hotel. Upon arrival this hotel is luxury from outside & continues into the lobby, I attempted my probably poor french explaining I had a reservation. The reservation staff realised I spoke English after my poor attempt to ask about parking and they automatically switched to help me out. I have never had such brilliant customer service in a hotel, they were friendly, polite, extremely helpful and didn't mind I was English. We paid 30 Euro's for parking but it was worth it, its such a busy area and the staff took the car & parked it in a secure location. The room was a very good size, with separate bathroom, which was also a great size and private balcony that we could see the Eiffel Tower from! I am so impressed with everything about this hotel and if I am staying in Paris again, I won't want to stay anywhere else. Only thing to avoid is Breakfast 18 Euro's for the smallest basket of bakery goods, tea, coffee & juice. The concierge showed us a indoor shopping area very close to the Hotel which had about 3 bakery's in & a supermarket. If you are looking at the Hotel go down the road to its right and a few doors down on the right you will find this shopping centre. Also Wifi was brilliant here & nesspresso machines in the room! I had an amazing night in Paris & will definitely be coming back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: materialboi
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel last minute as I was coming to Paris earlier than planned and my other hotel could not accommodate. The view of the Eiffel Tower from this hotel is sublime! I was lucky to get the top suite with the round window that perfectly frames the amazing view of the tower, it's postcard perfect!! It was also nice because I was in Paris on Bastille Day so the room was the PERFECT please to view the fireworks and celebrations without having to stan in the crazy crowds below! The room was a bit small but perfectly appointed, very clean and the bed was very very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and cheerful! A fantastic mid-range hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: PoppyBodenHarpers
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic little boutique hotel. It is conveniently situated in a quiet area near the Eiffel Tower/Trocedero. Lots of fab restarants, cafes etc and it feels more 'local' than 'tourist', which we prefer. All of the hotel staff were incredibly helpful, polite and welcoming, especially the concierge. The swimming pool is petit but still a luxury and the cocktail bar is definately worth a visit before you head off to enjoy the Parisian evening. The bedroom wassmall and cosy but perfectly formed and the bed as comfy as ever. The nespresso machine in the room was great for the morning pick-me-up. We loved this hotel and it is definately one to consider for a romantic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Totally completely ... beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: eli014
Reviews.Content: Rooms are of an extreme good taste, with modern furniture and very comfortable beds. In some rooms the bathroom is not separated by a door but by glass partitions with curtains: very particular! Some rooms are a little bit small but it's normal being the hotel an old building in pure french style. Breakfast is delicious and it's served in a part of the hotel that becomes a very chich restaurant at night. Mention of honor to the personnel. Everyone there is kind, helpful, smiling and always ready to answer any request. There is also a very good service of free valet parking which, considering that the 16th "arrondissement" is very busy trafic-wise, is the best! A stay at the Blu is "inoubliable" (unforgettable).

Reviews.Title: “"A View To Die For"”
Reviews.Author: TravelDocKleen11
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely happy with the smooth check in and the helpful Concierge who showed me to the Eiffel Suite. We were absolutely overwhelmed by the fantastic design of the Suite and the "to die for view" of the magnificent Eiffel Tower. I was, however, disappointed not to find the Champagne in the room. I called the Concierge and was told that the complimentary champagne will only be available in the evening. Having a special celebration and no champagne in the room? I then ordered a bottle of Champagne via room service for €85.00. It took 30 minutes for it to be delivered to the room and it was not even the right temperature. This was most annoying to both of us as we wanted to enjoy and celebrate our very short stay in Paris. I understand from the statement of features of the Eiffel Suite that the champagne is offered on the day of arrival and not in the evening of the day of our arrival as we were then told. I was deeply disappointed at the lack of flexibility from the staff to allow the complimentary champagne to be delivered to our Suite when I enquired about it. There were no full or any mirrors other then that in the bathroom. Also,there is no provision to hang one's used towel or gown in the bathroom. The marble bathtub is impractical, too deep and narrow. Not inviting! It reminded me of the huge ceramic washbasin my mother had in the laundry room. We left the Suite for dinner and requested the room to be made up. However, on our return from dinner, we find, although the room had been made up, the empty champagne bottle/bucket with tray had not been removed. We called the one button service to have the tray collected, but there was no response and we unhappily had to place it outside the door. Looking at dirty trays down Hotel corridors is not my idea of a luxury hotel. A further disappointment was that there were no complimentary newspapers available. Throughout the night there were terrible noise coming from the "overhead blinds", on the outside windows. This is a design mistake and should be seen to as one is constantly waken by the banging noise. We requested the Concierge to reserve Taxis for our respective train departures. I was told there had been an accident and therefore the delay. She did however, go outside the door to hail a Taxi from the street and its 17:00 hrs by the time I finally leave the hotel. From the situation I could but assume that the Taxi was not ordered by the new shift at Reception Desk as, while I waited in the reception area, no-one informed me of any delay of my ordered Taxi. I was immensely irritated as the train was scheduled for 18:13. Apart from the Champagne and Taxi blunders we most certainly enjoyed the fabulous Eiffel Suite, that alone is reason to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a great location with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: SThornton1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in June and wish we continued the rest of our stay here. The staff were extremely helpful, the quality of the hotel and furnishings were top notch. The room was relatively small, but quaint and very well equipd with iPod docks, a huge TV and a fantastic bath and Shower. The service in the restaurant and bar was of 5* standard and they went out of their way to help at every occasion offering helpful information and advice. We would return here if we re-visited Paris again without a shadow of a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay to experience Paris as its best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chanel_Ingrid
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived this beautiful hotel on the 17th of April and were welcomed by the hotel's friendly and very much helpful staff. The hotel is small, but extremly cozy and fashionable at the same time. The hotel's concierge will help you with absolutely everything you need to know in order to enjoy Paris the best way possible. The location of the hotel is excellent and the lovely view of the Eiffel Tower down the street takes your breath away! The area is quiet and very cozy with a nice restaurant, pharmacy, bank and a small flower shop. Only 3 minute walk to Trocadero and the metro. Only a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and also walking distance to Champs Elysees. You feel very safe walking around in this area and I promise you, you will fall in love in this magnificent city! The hotel is also a very big part of this great experience!! The restaurant served lovely french breakfast and the atmosphere with soothing sounds made you really relax and enjoy yourself. Our room had a big comfortable bed with bathtub and air condition to adjust the temperature just the way you like it. Every day, the houskeeping staff made sure our room was clean and fresh. So to all of you that wants to visit Paris: Make sure to stay at this hotel and get the best impression and experience of this beautiful city! I highly recommend Radisson Blu Le Metropolitan Hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very service oriented staff in convenient Paris location with fabulous views of the Eiffle Tower & access to other sites”
Reviews.Author: GS124
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff arranged transportation from the airport--excellent service. The rooms we had were a end suite and another 'basic' room Both were well appointed, comfortable and modern conveniences. The suite of course was larger with the most direct view of the Eiffel Tower. The location is within walking distance to the tower and to the trains/subway. The on site restaurant was good for several meals and the property's bar was inviting with a wonderful bartender--great personality of all the staff made this very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised how much I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: BNLX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu for work in March 2011. I was very skeptical about the hotel due to the location. Typically I like to stay closer to the Marais area. I actually ended up really liking this hotel! The pros were: * very nice, helpful staff * food - you can order breakfast ala cart (I was able to get eggs each morning for 8 euro) * the view - i could see the eiffel tower out my window - this was a really cool surprise! * grocery store and pastries - there is a mall with a grocery store 1/2 block away open until 10pm. It's big too with a full wine shop. GREAT selection of wine for cheap. You can go over there and get a good bottle of wine for 4 euro and order room service for 16 euro and you had a great dinner! * close to the Trocadero metro station - so you can easily get into the heart of the city * cafe's - there are a ton right there, you can sit out side and have a great view of the eiffel tower. I recommend this! * BON - walking distance for this great restaurant BON that the hotel recommended * Shower - awesome rain-can shower head * Bed - the bed was comfortable, the pillow were awesome (I want them for my house) and the linens were soft and clean. * FREE INTERNET! - this is HUGE, a lot of hotels charge $30 per day for this. AND it works! * Shopping - I was VERY surprised to see cute little boutiques right in the neighborhood! * Bar - the bar is great, open pretty late and have a view of the Eiffel tower! A must! Only cons * The room is a little dark - but I liked the lighting * Small - the room is cozy, but all Paris hotels are * Taxis - you have to order them, that was fine for me * Fitness center - they don't have a gym, but one of my colleagues ran in the near by park. They do have a pool, but I didn't check it out. * Great dark hard wood floors. LOVED them! Overall, this is one of my favorite Paris hotels and I decided to write about it because I was shocked at how much I loved it. A nice surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: kevshep
Reviews.Content: OK, first let me be honest and say that I only chose this hotel as I have been staying at the Raddison Blu in Jersey every week for the past 2 years on Business and therefore got the 2 nights for free on their Goldpoints reward programme. Which in itself is one of the best reward programmes I've used. We arrived early and the room wasn't ready, but they took our bags for us and we went off to explore the area. Loved the fact that opening the door of the Hotel you have a direct view of the Eiffel Tower. After some walking and the Modern Art Museum, we returned to the hotel at 3pm where we were told we'd been given an upgrade to a suite. (room 624) It's worth noting that this was a very cosy little suite with no view of the Tower but instead the side streets of Paris, this certainly wasn't a problem for us. The room was small with a large on-suite, including a black stone bath and large walk in shower. A small sitting area with Table and Nespresso maker were appreciated, although tea making facilities would have also been nice. Room service was quick and very tasty, we had Penne Pasta as main and Fromage for desert. It was a bit pricey, but seemed in line with Paris prices. All the staff were very kind and helpful to us. Overall a lovely 2 night Valentines weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Je t'aime!”
Reviews.Author: Sy2012
Reviews.Content: After hotel hopping around Disney we had a short stay before checking into our city apartment here and we loved it! This is definitely going down in my books as a fav... The place is more a boutique style, intimate & cozy compared to many of the radissons. Best shower ever! The rooms are much smaller but as they say - it's not the size that matters... A glass of vin on a cold, rainy Paris day by the fireplace in the cafe... Priceless.

Reviews.Title: “4 poster bed with a view to the tour Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: OsloSigne
Reviews.Content: My tiny rooftop room (622) with a view toward the Eiffel tower was very quiet and cosy. Minimalist in style, but still romantic and comfortable Bathroom in black tiles, huge windows, with big ran-style shower that easily flooded the bathroom floor. Floorplan shpows that rooms vary in size. I booked a single room, so thatds probabely why I got such a small room, but still with a double fourposter bed big anough for two. Good duvet and soft pillows, wall mounted tv set with little entertainment in English. Pleasant staff and tasty room service food. Pleasant bar with open fireplace next to reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great concierge, dodgy security.”
Reviews.Author: HMDUK
Reviews.Content: I was very hopeful. I chose this hotel as it is right next to my good friend's flat (she has a new baby, so I choose to stay at hotel instead) and very near the Trocadero. I've come to Paris many times and stayed at numerous hotels but this is by far my worst experience ever..and yet, it could have been so good so easily. The first room was promising. A view of the Eiffle Tower, small but clean room, a Nespresso machine and a double shower (no bath). But while taking a nap, I was accosted by slamming of doors which did not come from neighbouring rooms but the staff service doors upstairs. It went on for more than an hour so I had to surrender and request a change of room. This request was quickly and kindly attended to. I was moved to a first floor room which was at the end of a corridor on the same floor of the hotel bar. Even though this worries me, there was no noise coming from the outside of my room. The noise this time came from the very loud air conditioning vent INSIDE my room. But, switching the air off kills the noise, so I didn't mind too much.(though it gets really warm in the night) The rest of the list of disappointment are bearable. The freezing pool, the leaky ceiling dripping cold water on me while I lay by the pool, the broken pool tile, the raised floorboard in my room that trips me everytime I come out from the bathroom, the very expensive soggy smoked salmon sandwich I ordered from room service along with the foie gras that's gone just off. Because the Concierge was always kind when getting me a taxi or making me a reservation at a busy Louvre restaurant at the very last minute, I gladly forgive all the other disappointing points. What I'm writing next, I have to be very careful as it is not a mere complaint or observation but it crosses the line to accusation. All I can say is I have been made to understand that it was my fault that I did not use the safe provided in my room and that I should learn my lesson well. The sad thing is I never heard anything from the General Manager but was visited by the HouseKeeping Manager who proceeded to scold me and somehow manage to make me feel very, very bad. (I only realised afterward that he has suceeded to bullying a 40 year old woman.) Because this was the straw that broke the camel's back, I do not recommend this hotel. I shall never stay at this hotel again. I am very saddened by my experience. For £250 per night, no hotel should make you feel this bad.

Reviews.Title: “Absolultely Wonderful Hotel with Great, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: lelash
Reviews.Content: We travelled all over Europe and this hotel was one of the best. The room was unique in design and we loved the view of the Eiffel tower out our window. The room is decorated with class and the bed was very comfortable. Room Service was excellent and efficient. The Staff were very friendly and extemely helpful in suggesting good restaurants and shopping areas. We had no trouble getting around from this location. Paris is a wonderful city with so many great restaurants and things to do. If we return to Paris one day, we will definitely stay at the Le Metropolitan again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: pperkinsnh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on points, so price was not a factor. We thought the location was great, fairly quiet compared to much of the city. We opened our window to look out at the eiffel, which was fine with us. Just a block or two to 4-5 cafes on the walk to the Seine/Eiffel tower. More places to eat and drink down Rue Kebler. There is a grocery in a small mall just down the block, so water and fruit etc. are readily available. We walked for 3 days from this hotel, and saw the Arc, Louvre, Isle de cite and much more. We had no troubles with the staff whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when ordering your taxi!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anithasthlm
Reviews.Content: I visited the together with my hysdand during some days in September. After some days in wonderful Paris it was time for us to fly home to Monaco again. We then asked for a taxi to take us to the airport the morning after, and we specificly asked for a taxi from a WELLKNOWN company as G7 or TaxiBleue and the doorman at the hotel assured us and told us he would. The morning after we waited 15 minutes for the taxi to come with the doorman trying to tell us that the driver was on his way. When the taxi finally showed up the taximeter was already on 18 euros!!!!!!! And the taxi was not from a well known taxicompany but was driven by a chinese man from a little unknown company. As the taxi already was late we agreed to go in the taxi but we were afraid all the way to the airport as he speeded and almost had an accident with another car. Our advice is NOT to take the taxi this hotel will order you and my advice to you is to not go near this hotel at all. If they are not able to order a taxi for the clients something must be very very wrong. They did not change our towels for the whole stay either. Avoid them they do not respect you at all!!!! Louise and Henri Monaco

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the worst hotel I ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: ibrahamahmed
Reviews.Content: Arrived and waited three hours to get in room, the floor was actually broke and boards rising from the floor-they say they have a pool it is more like a baby pool with jets that you swim agains -one person maybe two could fit, room service is just the front desk clerk bringing up something--Don't be fooled by their pictures on their web site it is just a corner of a room and the smallest lobby and restaurant ever! I hope you read this and heed the warning!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame about the staff!”
Reviews.Author: MrsAE
Reviews.Content: First off - August is not a great time to be going to Paris, as all Parisians know - and get outta there! However, my husband and I went there for one day/night with our best friends and overall had a wonderful time. The hotel itself, if a little on the pricey side, is really good. It looks nice, feels nice. The rooms are good, modern - great bathrooms with top of the range hans grohe/axor bath brass wear, the beds are massive with big fluffy pillows. No complaints there. Location is marvellous also - with a great bar across the street to have some pre-dinner drinks. However - the staff seemed to dislike the English. When we arrived back from being out to dinner we were scornfully informed that the bar in the hotel "It's closed - It's August? We close at 11." - no mention of this in the information in the rooms which delighted to tell us that we could drink with magnficent views of the Eiffel Tower until 1am. At breakfast the waiter rudely mentioned that we would be getting contintental breakfast only (presumably due to it being August again) - I loved a glass of juice, a few pastries and a cup of coffee costing 18 euros per person! However, when a French couple sat down next to us they were greeted sweetly by the same waiter and presented with menus with a range of breakfasts to choose from. If we had not had such a fun time with our friends I would have been most disappointed with this hotel, considering how expensive it was. Perhaps some staff changes would be good?

Reviews.Title: “You Will Not Be Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: J2estrad
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I decided to go to Paris for our honeymoon, we were quickly overwhelmed by all of the hotel choices. Then we stumbled across the this hotel. We instantly fell in love with the black and white room and booked it. We stayed in France for 9 days and spent a few days in Strasbourg, Nice, Monaco and then back to Paris. Out of all the hotels Le Metropolitan was the best. I travel quite a bit through work, and I’ve been at five stars and black diamond hotels, so my standards are quite high. As I mentioned we came to Paris for our honeymoon, coming from Canada we were extremely exhausted… not only did they upgrade us at no extra charge, but they also had the room ready for us at 9:00 A.M.!!!! The room we got was amazing…extremely clean, everything looked brand new, the washroom was gorgeous… it just made everything feel perfect!!!! The staff themselves were also well above par, extremely courteous, they were so helpful that they even gave my new bride a toothbrush at 1:00 A.M. when she realized she forgot it. On our last day just before we left, the concierge was giving us tips about Nice, and all of the surrounding areas, told the cab driver which train station we needed and overall made us feel as if we were long time clients. Overall this was a great trip and my only regret was that we only spent three nights there as they were fully booked for the remainder of stay in Paris. I would truly recommend this hotel to all of my dearest friends and family… I cannot say enough just how happy my wife and were for selecting Le Metropolitan… And I promise if you book this hotel there is no way you could ever regret it!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: NorthEastVacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Metropolitan in December. The hotel is a ten minute walk from the eiffel tower. The nearest metro is the Trocadero (George Mandel exit) which is only a couple of minutes walk. The location was great! Fantatic spot in the center of Paris to see all the sites. The staff were helpful. We were initially given an incorrect room but they upgraded us immediately. The hotel is modern with lovely rooms, nice showers, good bar and a very nice restaurant and reception area. The breakfast in the hotel is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Relaxseeker
Reviews.Content: After having a bad time at Melia Colbert in Paris, we decided to leave the hotel and talked to the guys at Expedia and they put us on this very nice hotel. We had a great and lovely time, the hotel even has a Nespresso maker in the rooms, very nice furnished, can't say they are big rooms but average european in size but very modern and nicely furnished. The staff is extremely helpful and great concierge. It has a very nice lounge with a chimney great to sip Rose Champagne in the evening, a good restaurant and a nice bar. Just a 5 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower, which you can nicely view from the second floor bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sketchdnky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our first night in Paris at this hotel. As a frequent Radisson business traveler in the US, I decieded to use up some points. I am glad we chose to spend one night here! This hotel is a short walk to several Metro stops, a short walk to several beautiful cafe's and restraunts, and within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. This is a brand new hotel (two months or so) and it was beautiful. The staff were very helpful, kind, and friendly. The room was a bit small, with a layout that I have never seen before. Showerroom + sink, and the toilette across the room in a small room. Different. The shower was incredible. Rain shower, and plenty of room. Sink was very moden in design. The room had a Flat Screen (Usual channel line-up for French Hotels) and a wonderful bed. Hand drawn artwork on the walls. The downstairs Pool is a great touch, very modern as well. This is a beautiful niche hotel, seemingly catering to the business clientel, but a perfect stay for the wife and I. Perfect location, wonderful hotel.
